title: Newfoundland English Quiz
description: Discover the wonderfully unique dialect of Newfoundland, Canada!

questions.question: In Newfoundland English, what does 'b'y' (or 'by') mean?
options: A term of address for anyone (friend, buddy)

questions.question: What does 'stay where you're to till I comes where you're at' mean in Newfoundland English?
In Newfoundland, what is a 'screech-in'?
options: A ceremony to initiate visitors as honorary Newfoundlanders

questions.question: What does 'long may your big jib draw' mean in Newfoundland?
options: May you have good fortune and continued success

questions.question: In Newfoundland English, what is a 'touton'?
options: Fried bread dough, often served with molasses

questions.question: What does 'mauzy' mean in Newfoundland dialect?
In Newfoundland, what does 'where you longs to?' mean?
options: Where are you from? / Where is your hometown?
How long have you been here?

questions.question: What is 'jiggs dinner' in Newfoundland?
options: A traditional boiled dinner of salt beef with root vegetables and cabbage

questions.question: In Newfoundland English, what does 'right crooked' mean?
options: In a very bad mood or cranky

questions.question: What does 'gutfounded' mean in Newfoundland dialect?
What does 'slieveen' mean in Newfoundland English?
options: A sly, untrustworthy, or sneaky person

questions.question: In Newfoundland dialect, what does 'some good' mean?
What is a 'tickle' in Newfoundland geography?
options: A narrow saltwater strait between islands or rocks

questions.question: In Newfoundland English, what does 'give it a lash' mean?
options: Give it a try or attempt it
